H0.text: Digestive system -> circulatory system -> body cells is the pathway that most nutrients take after a person takes a bite of food.

H1.text: Circulatory system -> body cells -> digestive system is the pathway most nutrients take after a person takes a bite of food.

H2.text: Digestive system → body cells → circulatory system is the pathway most nutrients take after a person takes a bite of food.

H3.text: Circulatory system → digestive system → body cells is the pathway most nutrients take after a person takes a bite of food.

A4.text: When the digested food particles are reduced enough in size and composition, they can be absorbed by the intestinal wall and carried to the bloodstream.

A5.text: The last part of the small intestine is the ileum. This also contains villi and vitamin B12; bile acids and any residue nutrients are absorbed here.
